Ruby on Rails Developer

Mid-level web application engineer with professional development experience accross the stack with the Ruby on Rails framework. Hungry to learn new tech in and outside of work, because coding is fun and doesn't get old.

Space Bounce

In an effort to strengthen my Javascript skills (and because I've always wanted to create a game) I developed Space Bounce, a desktop HTML5 game that incorporates real time physics.

  • Play (dekstop only)
  • View Source Code

It is an object oriented Javascript application combining powerful JS libraries to bring it to life. The Flash-esque CreateJS library suite takes advantage of HTML5 and was used for vector graphics, animation, asset loading, audio, event handling, and more. The Box2DWeb library is an industrial strength physics engine used to handle all the physics in the game. I combined the two to map graphical objects to physical bodies, creating a game that is both interesting to play and look at.

Typically I work within a well structured framework such as Ruby on Rails, which uses the MVC architectural pattern. I did not do that for this project and by far the most difficult aspect of development was creating modular, decoupled code. This caused me to think hard about architecture in a way I haven't before. The implementation I took ended up taking advantage of established Javascript design patterns such as the Publish/Subscribe and Mediator pattern which greatly helped out.
